dt: {bc}marked by the primitive, gross, or elemental or by uncultivated simplicity or vulgarity
{bc}existing in a natural state and unaltered by cooking or processing
{bc}rough or inexpert in plan or execution
{bc}lacking a covering, glossing, or concealing element {bc}{sx|obvious||}
{bc}tabulated without being broken down into classes

pt: {sc}rude{/sc} {sc}rough{/sc} {sc}crude{/sc} {sc}raw{/sc} mean lacking in social refinement. {sc}rude{/sc} implies ignorance of or indifference to good form; it may suggest intentional discourtesy.
{sc}rough{/sc} is likely to stress lack of polish and gentleness.
{sc}crude{/sc} may apply to thought or behavior limited to the gross, the obvious, or the primitive.
{sc}raw{/sc} suggests being untested, inexperienced, or unfinished.

et: Middle English, from Latin {it}crudus{/it} raw, crude, undigested {ma}{mat|raw|}{/ma}
shortdef: marked by the primitive, gross, or elemental or by uncultivated simplicity or vulgarity
existing in a natural state and unaltered by cooking or processing
rough or inexpert in plan or execution
